structure.unit: COUNTY AND CITY BRIDGES, TUNNELS, AND FERRIES

law.catch_line: Counties may issue bonds to pay for bridges or tunnels.
law.text: Any county may issue and sell bonds for the purchase price or the cost of construction or reconstruction of such bridge or tunnel, including the necessary approach thereto and the necessary property for the construction or support of the bridge or tunnel, as now provided by law for the issuance and sale of bonds for the construction of roads, bridges and tunnels in this state.
law.history: Amended 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 92, sec. 255, effective January 1, 2015. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 384, sec. 51, effective June 17, 1978. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 938p-2.
